definition: lit. seeming neither close nor distant (idiom)/fig. to keep one's distance/(of a relationship) lukewarm/vague
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲

sentences.english: She stopped fitting me so closely and seemed offish .
sentences.chinese: 她不再那么紧贴着我，显得若即若离。

sentences.english: And some credit-card companies, albeit inadvertently, are still processing these transactions.
sentences.chinese: 有些信用卡公司仍若即若离地处理着网上赌博交易。

definition: In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
to drift apart/to become estranged/to alienate/estrangement
to worry about personal gains and losses
variant of 不答理[bu4 da1 li3]
